snippet: For the second straight playoff series, the Rangers are facing, in the Washington Capitals, an opponent playing just like them.
abstract: New York Rangers are preparing for Game 5 of Eastern Conference semifinals against Washington Capitals; series, which is tied 2-2, has featured diligent defense and shot-blocking from both sides. (M)
lead_paragraph: GREENBURGH, N.Y. -- For the second straight playoff series, the Rangers are facing an opponent playing just like them. The Washington Capitals, like the Ottawa Senators before them, check hard, block shots and play a suffocating defense -- just as the Rangers did throughout their 109-point regular season. The top-seeded Rangers do not seem surprised to be tied in their Eastern Conference semifinal series against the seventh-seeded Capitals at two games each. They do not seem surprised this series has featured alternating wins in the first four games -- the way their series unfolded against eighth-seeded Ottawa.

headline.main: Tight, Hard-Hitting Series Is Nothing New to Rangers
